channel.title: New and Clueless
channel.description:
Let me start off by saying that I've never made my own server or coded anything. All I've done is downloaded them and played them online.
Can someone please explain to me exactly what a server and a client are? I'm trying to get into making a rsps.
And also, when a download a server and a client that somebody made and extract them with winrar, how do i get to play them offline? I click run and nothing happens.

item.title: New and Clueless
item.dc:creator: @saltynuts saltynuts
item.description:
@saltynuts wrote:

to play offline dont portforward or dont use hamachi. just play it and code it until your comfortable about puttuing it online

Read full topic

item.title: New and Clueless
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

To play it offline you would have to make sure the client connects to your localhost, which is usually 127.0.0.1 or you can just put localhost. You will still need to portforward the ports 43594. I would read this tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html
It will explain in a lot more detail then I feel like giving over a keyboard.

Read full topic

item.title: New and Clueless
item.dc:creator: @wurzy1 wurzy1
item.description:
@wurzy1 wrote:

so when i download a server and a client that somebody has released, how do i play it just like offline?

Read full topic

item.title: New and Clueless
item.dc:creator: @saltynuts saltynuts
item.description:
@saltynuts wrote:

a server is the the files you use to code etc…(you use source files to get your rsps online) a client is pretty much a place to look at your codeing and stuff. orr it can be made for others players to download and play :p.

Read full topic
